subject: Re: Three diverse questions about testing
msgSnippet: ... supposed to ... rectangle, does ... a different ... with changing ... state) often ... not make ... I don t know how I can apply this to the solution of
messageBody:
> "Value semantics" in this context means that any method which is
supposed to
> change the state of the object, eg. stretch the side of a
rectangle, does
> not change the original object but returns a new object which has
a different
> internal state than the original object. Transforming an object
with changing
> state into a value object (which is *identified* by its internal
state) often
> requires you to change method names. And sometimes it just does
not make
> sense.
>
> Johannes

I don't know how I can apply this to the solution of the example.

So stretchX(amount) will return a new Square object which is
stretched by X and Y with the same amount?
